turns.text: My gums bleed when I brush. Should I be worried?
I'm sorry to hear that. Are your gums painful or swollen as well?
Not really, just bleeding a bit.
It could be early gum disease. Try brushing gently with a soft-bristled brush and flossing daily. If it doesn’t improve in a week or two, book a dentist appointment.
My teeth hurt when I eat ice cream.
That sounds like sensitivity. Do you also feel pain when eating sweet or hot foods?
You might benefit from a toothpaste for sensitive teeth. Avoid very cold or acidic foods and get checked for tooth decay.
When should my child start brushing their teeth?
As soon as their first tooth appears, usually around 6 months. Use a tiny smear of fluoride toothpaste and supervise them.
What kind of toothbrush should I use?
Use a soft baby toothbrush with a small head. Brush twice daily – especially before bed.
My wisdom tooth is really hurting.
Sorry to hear that. Is your cheek swollen or do you have trouble opening your mouth?
You could have an impacted wisdom tooth or an infection. Please book a dental appointment as soon as possible.
